Protection.nameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

PSS sessions for children to cope their stress and fears during COVID-19
NON-GBV actors trained on GBV prevention and referral
POCs trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: CLC-Domiz manager has attended GBVIMS monthly meeting via Skype. The purpose of the meeting, to discuss the refugee data, capacity building of new DGOs and ISP.
CLC-Domiz Manager has attended GBV working group meeting via Skype during the meeting new updates and information have been shared.
CLC- Domiz Manager has attended monthly protection meeting in camp management office during the meeting all updates from other agency have been shared with activities and plans for July.
CLC/Bardarash center manager has attended UNHCR online Bardarash protection meeting.
CLC/ Bardarash center manager has attended camp coordination meeting with camp management.
APM for GBV conducted eleven online PSEA CoC refresher trainings for 166 Harikar staff (70 males and 96 females) attended.
APM for GBV conducted two PSEA trainings for 21 Harikar staff (8 males and 13 females attended.

LivelihoodHighlights.GeneralHighlights: From 14th to 15th June 2020, Agriculture inputs and drip irrigation system was distributed in Zummar sub-district to 148 of Home garden beneficiaries for winter season in two villages affiliated to Zummar, 91 beneficiaries in the village of Ain Manea and 57 beneficiaries in Barzan village.

From 24th to 29th June, as part of the training activity, the Harikkar NGO conducted an agricultural training course for 57 beneficiaries of Home Garden in Barzan Village, which aims to develop and renew agricultural information for the mentioned beneficiaries. The course includes parts (practical and theoretical). This session was held in Barzan village for 57 farmers from the Arab ethnic group 42 male and 15 female farmers distributed over 5 groups, each group includes (10 to 12) beneficiaries,

WASHHighlights.GeneralHighlights: Hygiene kits are now ready in both Essian and Chamishku camps for blanket distribution in response to COVID-19 pandemic
40 volunteers were trained to do tent awreness visits in both Essian and Chamishku camps on the symptoms and the preventative measures of Corona virus.
COVID-19 tent awareness visits are ongoing in both Essian and Chamishku camps.
